markdownRemark.html: Agnes first appears in the written record when she was baptized at Marblehead's Anglican Church, St. Michael's on March 11, 1716. She died two years later on July 16, 1718 at the age of 43. She is the only known burial of a Person of Color at Old Burial Hill. Only one image of her stone exists. According to the carving on the gravestone, Agnes, or Agnis, was the "negro woman servant to Samuel Russell."

frontmatter.title: Agnes
frontmatter.description: Agnes' name first appears in the written record when she was baptized at Marblehead's Anglican Church, St. Michael's on March 11, 1716.
